de.mrapp.android.validation

Class PasswordEditText

  • java.lang.Object
    • LinearLayout
      • de.mrapp.android.validation.AbstractValidateableView<android.widget.EditText,java.lang.CharSequence>
        • de.mrapp.android.validation.EditText
          • de.mrapp.android.validation.PasswordEditText
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Validateable<java.lang.CharSequence>

    public class PasswordEditText
extends EditText
    A view, which allows to enter a password. The text may be validated according to the pattern, which is suggested by the Material Design guidelines. Additionally, the password strength can be automatically verified, according to customizable constraints, while typing and a text, which indicates the password strength can be shown as the edit text's helper text.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

      • PasswordEditText

        public PasswordEditText(Context context,
                        AttributeSet attributeSet,
                        int defaultStyle,
                        int defaultStyleResource)
        Creates a new view, which allows to enter a password.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the view, as an instance of the class Context
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the view, as an instance of the type AttributeSet
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource
        defaultStyleResource - A resource identifier of a style resource that supplies default values for the preference, used only if the default style is 0 or can not be found in the theme. Can be 0 to not look for defaults

      • getHelperTexts

        public final java.util.Collection<java.lang.CharSequence> getHelperTexts()
        Returns a collection, which contains the helper texts, which are shown, depending on the password strength. Helper texts at higher indices are supposed to indicate a higher password strength.
        Returns:
        A collection, which contains the helper texts, which are shown, depending on the password strength, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no helper texts are shown depending on the password strength

      • addHelperText

        public final void addHelperText(java.lang.CharSequence helperText)
        Adds a new helper text, which should be shown, depending on the password strength. Helper texts, which have been added later than others, are supposed to indicate a higher password strength.
        Parameters:
        helperText - The helper text, which should be added, as an instance of the type CharSequence. The helper text may neither be null, nor empty

      • addHelperTextId

        public final void addHelperTextId(int resourceId)
        Adds a new helper text, which should be shown, depending on the password strength. Helper texts, which have been added later than others, are supposed to indicate a higher password strength.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource ID of the helper text, which should be added, as an Integer value. The resource ID must correspond to a valid string resource

      • addAllHelperTexts

        public final void addAllHelperTexts(java.util.Collection<java.lang.CharSequence> helperTexts)
        Adds all helper texts, which are contained by a specific collection. The helper texts are added in the given order.
        Parameters:
        helperTexts - A collection, which contains the helper texts, which should be added, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no helper texts should be added
